revised_title: Spectrum Analysis with a Train of Sulphide-of-Carbon Prisms
tldr: The author describes a new method for spectrum analysis using a train of eleven sulphide-of-carbon prisms. The prisms offer increased dispersion and a larger field of view, allowing for more precise mapping of the solar spectrum. The author shares observations of the solar spectrum, including the double D line, and notes the potential for further discoveries with this method.
